cooking_method: 1. Cook egg noodles according to package instructions. Drain and set aside.2. In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium-high heat. Add beef sirloin and cook until browned on all sides. Remove beef from skillet and set aside. 3. Add butter to the skillet and melt over medium heat. Add onion and garlic and cook until softened, about 5 minutes. 4. Add sliced mushrooms to the skillet and cook until tender, about 5-7 minutes. 5. Sprinkle flour over the vegetables and stir to combine. Gradually stir in beef broth and bring to a simmer. Add cooked beef to the skillet and stir to combine. 6. Simmer for 10-15 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened. Remove from heat and stir in sour cream. 7. Serve beef stroganoff over egg noodles.

ingredients: 2 tbsp chopped fresh herbs (such as thyme, rosemary, and parsley)
cooking_method: 1. Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C). 2. In a small bowl, mix together softened butter, chopped herbs, minced garlic, salt, and black pepper. 3. Rub the butter mixture all over the chicken, including under the skin and in the cavity. 4. Place lemon slices inside the chicken cavity. 5. Tie the legs together with kitchen twine and tuck the wings under the bird. 6. Place the chicken on a roasting pan and roast for 1 hour and 15 minutes, until the internal temperature reaches 165°F (74°C). 7. Let the chicken rest for 10 minutes before carving and serving.

1. Cook spaghetti according to package instructions. Reserve 1 cup of pasta water. 2. In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add pancetta and cook until crispy, about 5-7 minutes. 3. In a bowl, whisk together eggs, Parmesan cheese, Pecorino Romano cheese, and black pepper. 4. Drain spaghetti and add it to the skillet with the pancetta. Remove skillet from heat. 5. Slowly pour the egg mixture over the spaghetti while stirring constantly. Add reserved pasta water, a tablespoon at a time, until the sauce is creamy and coats the pasta. 6. Serve spaghetti carbonara with chopped fresh parsley.

Remove beef from skillet and set aside. 3. Add butter to the skillet and melt over medium heat. Add onion and garlic and cook until softened, about 5 minutes. 4. Add sliced mushrooms to the skillet and cook until tender, about 5-7 minutes. 5. Sprinkle flour over the vegetables and stir to combine. Gradually stir in beef broth and bring to a simmer. Add cooked beef to the skillet and stir to combine. 6. Simmer for 10-15 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened. Remove from heat and stir in sour cream. 7. Serve beef stroganoff over egg noodles.
